name: MinecraftLauncher-core
description: A Node.js solution for launching modded and vanilla Minecraft without having to download and format everything yourself. Basically a launcher core for Electron or script based launchers

name: Personal Website
description: My personal website that is built with React and TypeScript while being hosted on GitHub Pages. It is a simple website that showcases my projects and provides a way to contact me

name: AI Virtual Assistant
description: My team's capstone project that helps voters recover their lost ballot pin, as well as answer FAQs using Azure's Conversational Language Understanding Model. Frontend: TypeScript/React, Backend: C#, Middleware/Server Stack: Django and PostgreSQL. Code can be provided upon request

name: ResponSight ML
description: Provided automotive collision forcasting to help EMS minimize response time, by leveraging machine learning. Our team trained our model on historic data and use INRIX APIs to make real-time predictions

name: t4.ts
description: A TypeScript library for working with the TerminalFour Content Manager API. Powers all of the scripts and tools that I have written for the Seattle University CMS

name: MapBan - Rainbow6
description: A simple Node.js Discord bot for competitive Rainbow6 Siege that was written for CCS Esports. This bot briged the gap between the production team and the players by allowing them to ban maps and select sides

name: WildBeast
description: Wildbeast is a multifunctional Discord bot written in TypeScript, intended to provide a framework that's easy to use, extend, and modify. Primary controbutions include the XKCD commic command and the ability get Twitch stream information and updates
